preqs: Students must have passed ECB1101 or ECG1102 or ECS1101 or ECW1102 or ECS1102 and ECB2331 or ECG2731 or ECS2731 or ECW2731.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ECG1102, ECW1102} AND  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ECG2731, ECW2120, ECW2731})
Must be enrolled in course type {10, 13, 20, 41, 50}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ECB3121, ECC3690, ECF3121, ECG9121, ECS3121}
Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ECB1102, ECB2731, ECG1102, ECG2731, ECS1102, ECS2731, ECW1102, ECW2731} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Must be enrolled in course type {10, 20, 41, 50}

description: The pure theory of international trade. Trade and income distribution, economic growth and changes in trade, bases for trade and gains from trade. Trade policy. Tariffs, quotas, subsidies, import discrimination and other national policies affecting trade. The foreign exchange market. Determination of exchange rates, the balance of payments, modern foreign exchange policies and the threat of unstable exchange rates.
